articles.title: Kim Jong Il Visits Inner Mongolian Autonomous Region
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Visits Inner Mongolian Autonomous Region

					 Pyongyang, August 26 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and chairman of the National Defence Commission of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, on August 25 visited the Inner Mongolian Autonomous Region located in the Northeast area of the People's Republic of China on his way home after winding up his visit to the Siberian and Far East regions of Russia.
					
					 He arrived in Manzhouli of the Inner Mongolian Autonomous Region, the border railway station, this afternoon.
					
					 When the train pulled in the railway station, he was warmly greeted by Wang Jiarui, head of the International Liaison Department of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China, Sheng Guangzu, minister of Railways, Hu Chunhua, secretary of the Inner Mongolian Autonomous Regional Party Committee, Fu Taizeng, secretary general of the autonomous regional party committee, Luo Zhihu, secretary of the Hulun Buir City Party Committee, the mayor of Hulun Buir City, the secretary of the Manzhouli City Party Committee and other central and local senior officials of China. 
					
					 He exchanged cordial greetings with the senior officials and had a talk with them.
					
					 Wang Jiarui said he was specially dispatched to Manzhouli to conduct Kim Jong Il who is passing through the PRC upon the authorization of the collective leadership of China including Hu Jintao. He paid highest tribute to Kim Jong Il for having made a great contribution to boosting the friendship among countries and accomplishing the human cause of independence through his energetic external activities.
					
					 Kim Jong Il thanked Wang Jiarui and other senior central and local officials and people for their warm reception.
					
					 He, conducted by senior party and government officials of the autonomous region, toured Hailar District, Hulun Buir City of the region. 
					
					  Commanding a bird's-eye view of the night scenery, he got familiar with the history and culture of the region and the achievements made by its people in construction.
					
					 The Inner Mongolian Autonomous Regional Committee of the CPC gave a grand banquet at the Tianjiao State Guest House in honor of Kim Jong Il visiting the region.
					
					 He was present on invitation.
					
					 Speeches were made.
					
					 Hu Chunhua said that today we welcomed Kim Jong Il to this vast steppe where President Kim Il Sung was accorded warm welcome several times long ago, thereby seeing the desire of the party, the government and the people of the autonomous region come true at last.
					
					 Hu Chunhua noted that the traditional Sino-DPRK friendship will remain ever-green like the vast steppe along with history, expressing firm belief that the friendly Korean people would make fresh success in the efforts to improve the standard of people's living and build a prosperous and powerful nation.
					
					 A specially prepared art performance was given in honor of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Artistes of the autonomous region including Hulun Buir National Song and Dance Troupe put on the stage such colorful numbers strong in national flavor as national song and dance "Song of Wedding", national instrumental solo "Vast Steppe",  dance "Dance of Bowl", chorus "Calling You" and Korean song "Arirang".
					
					 The performers clearly reflected the boundless respect and reverence of the government and the people of the region for Kim Jong Il visiting China again for the development of the Sino-DPRK friendship.
					
					 Kim Jong Il conveyed a floral basket to the performers in congratulation of their successful performance and had a photo taken with them.
					
					 He was presented with a gift by Hu Chunhua on behalf of the party committee of the autonomous region.
					
					 He expressed thanks for the warm reception and cordial hospitality accorded him by the party, government and people of the Inner Mongolian Autonomous Region. He hoped the people of the region would achieve a fresh victory in their struggle for the prosperity and development of the country under the leadership of the CPC.
					
					 Kim Jong Il departed for the next destination that day amid the warm send-off from the leading officials of the region.
					
					 He was accompanied by Kim Yong Chun, member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK and minister of the People's Armed Forces, Kang Sok Ju, member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK and vice-premier of the Cabinet, Jang Song Thaek, alternate member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK and vice-chairman of the NDC, and Kim Yong Il, Kim Yang Gon, Pak To Chun and Thae Jong Su, alternate members of the Political Bureau and secretaries of the C.C., the WPK, Pak Pong Ju, first vice department director of the C.C., the WPK, and O Su Yong, chief secretary of the North Hamgyong Provincial Committee of the WPK, Ji Jae Ryong, DPRK ambassador to China, and Ri Ki Pom, DPRK consul general in Shenyang.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Passes through Heilongjiang Province, China
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Passes through Heilongjiang Province, China

					 Pyongyang, August 26 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and chairman of the National Defence Commission of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, on August 26 passed through Heilongjiang Province, the People's Republic of China.
					
					 He arrived in Qiqihar City, Heilongjiang Province this morning.
					
					 When the train pulled in Qiqihar Railway Station, he was warmly greeted by Ji Bingxuan, secretary of the Heilongjiang Provincial Party Committee, Wang Xiankui, governor of Heilongjiang Province, the secretary of the Qiqihar City Party Committee, the mayor of Qiqihar City and other senior party and government officials of the province and the city.
					
					 He was accompanied by Kim Yong Chun, member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK and minister of the People's Armed Forces, Kang Sok Ju, member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK and vice-premier of the Cabinet, Jang Song Thaek, alternate member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK and vice-chairman of the NDC, Kim Yong Il, Kim Yang Gon, Pak To Chun and Thae Jong Su, alternate members of the Political Bureau and secretaries of the C.C., the WPK, Pak Pong Ju, first vice department director of the C.C., the WPK, O Su Yong, chief secretary of the North Hamgyong Provincial Committee of the WPK, Ji Jae Ryong, DPRK ambassador to China, and Ri Ki Bom, DPRK consul general in Shenyang.
					
					 He was also accompanied by Wang Jiarui, head of the International Liaison Department of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China, Sheng Guangzu, minister of Railways, and other senior central officials.
					
					 He exchanged greetings with the senior officials and had a talk with them.
					
					 Ji Bingxuan said it is great honor and pride to welcome to their place Kim Jong Il on a long foreign tour for friendship among countries and warmly welcomed him on behalf of the party, the government and the people of Heilongjiang Province.
					
					 This day Kim Jong Il on a visit to Northeast China was kindly greeted by Dai Bingguo, state councilor of China who came to Heilongjiang Province upon the special authorization of General Secretary Hu Jintao and the Central Committee of the CPC.
					
					 He exchanged warm greetings with Dai Bingguo and had a talk with him.
					
					 Dai Bingguo said that Northeast China receiving Kim Jong Il again after the lapse of three months is now wrapped in a festive atmosphere. He offered warm welcome to Kim Jong Il on behalf of General Secretary Hu Jintao, the collective leadership of the CPC and all the Chinese people.
					
					 Dai Bingguo said the appreciation made by Kim Jong Il of the socialist modernization drive in China while traveling Inner Mongolia and Heilongjiang Province constitutes great encouragement and support to the Chinese people advancing under the leadership of the CPC, adding that the party, government and people of China would join the Korean comrades in striving hard to boost the traditional Sino-DPRK friendship.
					
					 Dai Bingguo hosted a banquet at the Sianhe State Guesthouse in Qiqihar City in honor of Kim Jong Il visiting Northeast China.
					
					 Kim Jong Il learned about the economic development in the province, visiting various enterprises and construction projects in Qiqihar City and Daqing City of the province this day.
					
					 He was accompanied by Dai Bingguo, Wang Jiarui, Sheng Guangzu, Ji Bingxuan, Wang Xiankui and other central, provincial and city party and government leading officials.
					
					 Kim Jong Il visited the Qiqihar Machine Tool Group Co. No. 2 and the Qiqihar Branch Company of the Mengniu Dairy.
					
					 He also visited the urban planning exhibition hall in Daqing City and was briefed on the urban construction and long-term plan. Then he went round the housing construction district, a large bridge, Lake Liming Bridge now under construction and other places in the province.
					
					 The provincial party committee gave a banquet at the Daqing State Guesthouse No. 9 this evening in honor of Kim Jong Il visiting the province. 
					
					 He was present at the banquet on invitation.
					
					 Ji Bingxuan said that the historic visit paid by Kim Jong Il to Heilongjiang Province again after the lapse of the three months is a striking demonstration of the Sino-DPRK friendship growing stronger day by day, adding that the provincial party, government and people would join the Korean people in playing a greater role in inheriting and developing the Sino-DPRK friendship generation after generation.
					
					 A special performance was given in welcome of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The performance was given by well-known national art troupes and artistes in the region including the national music band and dancing troupe of the Music and Dance Theatre of Heilongjiang Province.
					
					 Their repertoire included male solo "Song of Boats on the River Wusuli ", dance "Blessing", instrumental music duet "Celebration" and Korean songs "We Spread Flower Seeds of Revolution", "Glad to See You" and "Platycodon".
					
					 Kim Jong Il conveyed a floral basket to the artistes in congratulation of their successful performance.
					
					 He was presented with a gift by the provincial party and people's government this day in welcome of him visiting the province.
					
					 He expressed thanks for the warm reception and cordial hospitality accorded to him by the party, government and people of Heilongjiang Province. He hoped the people of the province would achieve a fresh victory in their struggle for the prosperity and development of the country under the leadership of the CPC.
					
					 Kim Jong Il departed for the next destination this day amid the warm send-off by Dai Bingguo and senior officials of the province.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Sends Message of Thanks to Medvedev
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Sends Message of Thanks to Medvedev

					 Pyongyang, August 26 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Il, chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, Thursday sent a message of thanks to Dmitri Anatoliyevich Medvedev, president of the Russian Federation, on his way home after winding up his visit to Siberia and the Far East Region of Russia.
					
					 The message said:
					
					 Upon leaving your country for home after winding up my visit to Siberia and the Far East Region of friendly neighbor Russia, I extend profound thanks to you and the Russian government and leading officials of the Siberian and Far East regions of your Federation and the close Russian people for the warm reception and cordial hospitality accorded to us.
					
					 I am very satisfied that I met you and reached a consensus of views on all issues of mutual concern during my visit to Russia.
					
					 We were deeply impressed to see the diligent people in Siberia and the Far East Region working hard with sincerity for the socio-economic development and prosperity, while touring their vast land.
					
					 It is my belief that the long-standing DPRK-Russia friendly and cooperative relations will grow strong in the future, too, in the spirit of the recent agreement reached between us.
					
					 Availing myself of this opportunity, I sincerely hope that you and the Russian people will register greater success in the work for building powerful and modern Russia and you enjoy good health.

articles.title: China Attaches Great Importance to Friendly Relations with DPRK: Chinese Defense Minister
articles.content:
China Attaches Great Importance to Friendly Relations with DPRK: Chinese Defense Minister

					Pyongyang, August 26 (KCNA) -- Colonel General Liang Guanglie, state councilor and minister of National Defense of China, met and had a talk with a delegation of logistics officials of the Korean People's Army led by Colonel General Jon Chang Bok at the August 1 Building in Beijing on August 26.
					
					 The minister recalled with deep emotion that when he visited the DPRK, General Secretary Kim Jong Il received his delegation though he was hard pressed for time.
					
					 The traditional Sino-DPRK friendship provided by President Kim Il Sung together with the leaders of the elder generation of China including Chairman Mao Zedong and Premier Zhou Enlai is developing more favorably under the deep care of the top leaders of the two countries, he noted, adding Kim Jong Il recently visited China several times.
					
					 China is attaching great importance to the friendly relations between the two countries, he stressed.
					
					 He hoped that the friendly relations between the two peoples and the two armies would be put onto a new higher stage and cooperation increase in various fields in the future, too.

articles.title: Choe Yong Rim Meets Russian Government Economic Delegation
articles.content:
Choe Yong Rim Meets Russian Government Economic Delegation

					 Pyongyang, August 26 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Choe Yong Rim met and had a talk with the Russian government economic delegation headed by Minister of Regional Development Viktor Basargin, chairman of the Russian side to the DPRK-Russia Intergovernmental Committee for Cooperation in Trade, Economy, Science and Technology, on Friday when it paid a courtesy call on him at the Mansudae Assembly Hall.

articles.title: DPRK, Russia Cooperate
articles.content:
DPRK, Russia Cooperate 

					 Pyongyang, August 26 (KCNA) -- The 5th meeting of the DPRK-Russia Intergovernmental Committee for Cooperation in Trade, Economy, Science and Technology took place at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Friday.
					
					 Attending it were Ri Ryong Nam, minister of Foreign Trade and chairman of the DPRK side to the Committee, and officials concerned and members of the Russian government economic delegation led by Minister of Regional Development Viktor Basargin, chairman of the Russian side to the Committee, and Arkady Lavrov, charge d'affaires a.i. of the Russian embassy here.
					
					 The meeting dealt with matters to boost cooperation in trade, economy and science and technology between the two countries.
					
					 That day the DPRK side to the Committee hosted a reception in honor of the Russian delegation at Pyongyang Koryo Hotel.

articles.title: Protocol Signed between DPRK and Russia
articles.content:
Protocol Signed between DPRK and Russia

					 Pyongyang, August 26 (KCNA) -- A protocol of the 5th Meeting of the DPRK-Russia Intergovernmental Committee for Cooperation in Trade, Economy, Science and Technology was signed at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Friday. 
					
					 Present there were Ri Ryong Nam, minister of Foreign Trade and chairman of the DPRK side to the Committee, and officials concerned and the members of the Russian governmental economic delegation led by Minister of Regional Development Viktor Basargin, chairman of the Russian side to the Committee, and Arkady Lavrov, charge d'affaires a.i. of the Russian embassy here.
					
					 Ri Ryong Nam and Viktor Basargin inked the protocol.

articles.title: Russian Delegation Visits Martyrs Cemetery and Liberation Tower
articles.content:
Russian Delegation Visits Martyrs Cemetery and Liberation Tower in Pyongyang

					 Pyongyang, August 26 (KCNA) -- The visiting Russian government economic delegation led by Minister of Regional Development Viktor Basargin, chairman of the Russian side to the DPRK-Russia Intergovernmental Committee for Cooperation in Trade, Economy, Science and Technology, visited the Revolutionary Martyrs Cemetery on Mt. Taesong and the Liberation Tower here on Friday to pay floral tribute.
					
					 The guests laid bouquets before the bust of anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk at the cemetery.
					
					 Placed at the cemetery was a wreath in the name of the Russian government.
					
					 They observed a moment's silence in memory of the revolutionary martyrs.
					
					 They also laid a wreath in the name of the Russian government at the Liberation Tower and paid a silent tribute to the memory of the fallen Soviet Army soldiers.

articles.title: Russian Delegation Tours Mangyongdae
articles.content:
Russian Delegation Tours Mangyongdae

					 Pyongyang, August 26 (KCNA) -- The delegation of the Eastern Military District of the Armed Forces of the Russian Federation led by Commander Konstantin Sidenko visited Mangyongdae, birthplace of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 Being briefed on the revolutionary history of the President and the patriotic and revolutionary Mangyongdae family members, the visitors looked round the historic relics preserved at his old home there. Then they went round the historic sites on Mangyong Hill.
					
					 The delegation also toured Pueblo, an armed spy ship of the U.S. imperialists, the International Friendship Exhibition House, the West Sea Barrage and other places and enjoyed the grand gymnastic and artistic performance "Arirang", a winner of Kim Il Sung Prize.

articles.title: Russian High-ranking Military Officer Interviewed
articles.content:
Russian High-ranking Military Officer Interviewed

					 Pyongyang, August 26 (KCNA) -- Konstantin Sidenko, commander of the Eastern Military District of the Armed Forces of the Russian Federation, was interviewed by KCNA on Friday before departing from here after wrapping up his delegation's visit to the DPRK.
					
					 While touring various places during the delegation's stay here, I felt a lot, he said, and continued:
					
					 What is the most important is that the army and the people of the DPRK have boundless reverence for Supreme Commander Kim Jong Il.
					
					 I think that the delegation's visit to the DPRK contributed to exchanging experience and cooperating with each other.
					
					 It is important to boost the friendly and cooperative relations between the armies and peoples of the two countries.
					
					 The visit to Russia paid by General Secretary Kim Jong Il again proves that he is attaching importance to the DPRK-Russia friendship.
					
					 His visit to Russia is of weighty significance in developing the Russia-DPRK friendly relations onto a new higher stage.
					
					 If I were in Russia, I would have had an honor of meeting Kim Jong Il.
					
					 We will set store by the traditional good neighborly and friendly relations with the Korean people and make efforts to have multifaceted cooperation and exchange in the future, too.
					
					 I am convinced that the Russia-DPRK friendship provided by the top leaders of the two countries will grow stronger in the common interests.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Strong Sense of Obligation to Internationalist
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Strong Sense of Obligation to Internationalist 

					 Pyongyang, August 26 (KCNA) -- Ya. T. Nobichenko, an ordinary Russian, was one of the foreign people who led a happy life under deep care of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 Nobichenko was an internationalist soldier who protected the President from danger at the risk of his life.
					
					 When the President was addressing a mass rally in Pyongyang just after the liberation of the country from the Japanese colonial rule, one of the hostile elements present at the rally threw a handgrenade towards the platform.
					
					 At that critical moment, Nobichenko covered the explosive with his body, saving many people and leaving himself seriously wounded.
					
					 At that time, he was admired by all people for his heroic deed. With the passage of years, however, he had faded out of their memory. 
					
					 It was only the President who had always kept the internationalist in his memory.
					
					 One day Kim Il Sung told officials that Nobichenko, though injured, might be alive in view of his age. He then asked them to find out Nobichenko.
					
					 When he was told that Nobichenko was spending his remaining years in his home village in Siberia, he felt great pleasure.
					
					 He met Nobichenko in May Juche 73 (1984) when he was on a historic visit to the Soviet Union.
					
					They had an emotion-packed meeting after nearly four decades.
					
					 Kim Il Sung told officials that it was heroic for Nobichenko, a foreigner, to display such self-sacrificing spirit and suggested he be awarded the title of Labor Hero of the DPRK.
					
					 So, Nobichenko became Labor Hero of the DPRK some days after he met the President.
					
					 Kim Il Sung, regarding Nobichenko as his close friend and younger brother, invited him to visit the DPRK several times to spend a good time with every possible convenience available for him.
					
					 Whenever Nobichenko visited the DPRK together with his family, the President met them and bestowed many kindnesses on them.
					
					 He also appreciated Nobichenko's wife for her devotion to her handicapped husband and all other family members. 
					
					 Nobichenko, though he lost one of his arms, had enjoyed a happy life with his family under deep care of the President.  
					
					 In his lifetime, Nobichenko respected the President as his elder brother, admiring his strong sense of moral obligation.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung Praised by Chinese
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung Praised by Chinese

					  Pyongyang, August 26 (KCNA) -- The delegation of the Chinese People's Daily today visited Mangyongdae where President Kim Il Sung was born and spent his childhood.
					
					 After the visit head of the delegation Yan Xiaoming, secretary general of the People's Daily, said that he was pleased to visit the old home of the President. 
					
					 He went on:
					
					 The President, who was born in a simple family, devoted his all to the country and the people.
					
					 He conducted energetic activities to develop the traditional friendship between China and the DPRK.
					
					 He is always alive in the hearts of the two peoples as he performed the feats in strengthening the Sino-DPRK friendly and cooperative relations.
					
					 The Sino-DPRK friendship provided by him together with the revolutionaries of the elder generation of China will be everlasting.
					
					 The delegation also toured the Tower of the Juche Idea, the Arch of Triumph, the Friendship Tower, the Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Museum and other places.

articles.title: AP Delegation Flies Back Home
articles.content:
AP Delegation Flies Back Home

					 Pyongyang, August 26 (KCNA) -- The delegation of AP led by Vice President John Daniszewski left here for home by air on Friday.

articles.title: 9th National Ssirum Tournament for Grand Bull Prize Held
articles.content:
9th National Ssirum Tournament for Grand Bull Prize Held

					 Pyongyang, August 26 (KCNA) -- The 9th National Ssirum (Korean wrestling) Tournament for Grand Bull Prize was held at the wrestling site on Rungna Islet from August 24 to 26.
					
					 The tournament brought together more than 100 wrestlers from Pyongyang and each province. Divided into catch-weight and body-weight categories, they competed in knockout and league matches.
					
					 10 grapplers matched in the catch-weight category event in which Ri Jo Won, wrestler from North Phyongan Province, came first, winning the third straight title.
					
					 North Phyongan Province placed first in team standing, Pyongyang second and South Hamgyong Province third in the body-weight category event.
					
					 At the closing ceremony a grand bull, a gold bull bell and diploma were awarded to Ri Jo Won.

articles.title: New Health Foodstuffs Developed in DPRK
articles.content:
New Health Foodstuffs Developed in DPRK

					 Pyongyang, August 26 (KCNA) -- The Research Institute for Nutrition Care of Children in Pyongyang has developed health foodstuffs essential for children's growth.
					
					 Among them are powdered lactic acid bacteria good for children's diarrhea, baby's dried bean-flour drink containing nutritive substances like mother's milk, pills full of vitamins and mineral matters needed for the increase of children's stature.
					
					 The institute belonging to the Academy of Medical Science has also developed a new diagnostic method of lactose intolerance to prevent children's dystrophy.
					
					 Sour drink made with potato is efficacious for baby's diarrhea and indigestion as it contains various nutritive substances, antibiotic and immunity matters and amylase.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun on History and Tradition of DPRK-Russia Friendship
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun on History and Tradition of DPRK-Russia Friendship

					Pyongyang, August 26 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il's recent historic visit to Siberia and the Far East Region of Russia was recorded as a brilliant chapter in the annals of the DPRK-Russia friendship, says Rodong Sinmun in a bylined article Friday.
					
					 The friendly relations between the DPRK and Russia have a long history and tradition, it says, adding:
					
					 During the anti-Japanese armed struggle President Kim Il Sung fully supported the Soviet people's cause of justice under the slogan "Let Us Defend the Soviet Union with Arms!", thus strengthening the militant ties with them.
					
					 Leader Kim Jong Il sets store by the DPRK-Russia friendship and shows deep care for development of the bilateral relations. His energetic external activities were recorded brilliantly in the history of the DPRK-Russia friendship and they greatly contributed to boosting this traditional friendship and ensuring peace and security in Asia and the rest of the world.
					
					 In recent years the bilateral relations of friendship and cooperation have developed in depth in various fields in conformity with the spirit of the agreements reached between the two countries.
					
					 This development confirms to the desire and interests of the peoples of the two countries and it is helpful to ensuring peace and security in Asia and the rest of the world.
					
					 The Korean people appreciate the efforts made by the Russian government and people to achieve the social progress and defend the security and interests of the country, heartily hoping that everything would go well in Russia.
					
					 The DPRK and Russia make joint efforts for peace and security of the Asia-Pacific region including Northeast Asia and fair solution to the international issues.
					
					 The DPRK-Russia friendly and cooperative relations will grow stronger day by day by the concerted efforts of the two governments and peoples.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Termed Arch Criminal Escalating Tension and Wrecking peace
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Termed Arch Criminal Escalating Tension and Wrecking Peace

					 Pyongyang, August 26 (KCNA) -- The Ulji Freedom Guardian joint military exercises kicked off in south Korea on August 16 created such dangerous situation on the Korean Peninsula that a war may break out any moment. 
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Friday says this in a bylined article.
					
					 Through this saber-rattling the world clearly knows once again who is the arch criminal wrecking peace on the Korean Peninsula and escalating the tension there, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 UFG is a preliminary war and test nuclear war aimed to round off the preparations for a war of aggression against the north.
					
					 An extremely provocative exercise called "operations to stabilize the north and transfer power to civilians" was staged as part of this saber-rattling with various administrative bodies involved. This is the real picture of the joint military exercises dubbed "exercises of defensive nature."
					
					 Lurking behind this racket kicked up by the south Korean authorities, hurling even civilians into the saber-rattling is a sinister intention to tone down the growing anti-"government" feelings among the people, chill their desire to achieve the reunification through an alliance with the north and divert elsewhere the public attention in a bid to tide over their ruling crisis.
					
					 UFG staged by the south Korean authorities is the product of their criminal attempt to stem the trend of detente on the peninsula and escalate the confrontation.
					
					 It brought to light the true colors of the south Korean authorities working hard to ignite a war for aggression against the north while paying lip-service to "peace" and "cooperation" to make a mockery of public opinion at home and abroad.

articles.title: Civilian Planes Involved in UFG
articles.content:
Civilian Planes Involved in UFG

					 Pyongyang, August 26 (KCNA) -- The south Korean authorities on August 25 staged drills of transporting wounded by civilian planes as part of the Ulji Freedom Guardian joint military exercises, according to south Korean Yonhap News.
					
					 Passenger planes and helicopters of three civilian air services and 10 units were involved in these war exercises staged at the air force bases in Suwon, Taegu and Kimhae with the cooperation of the U.S. forces.
					
					 It was the first time that the drills of transporting wounded in case of emergency were staged with such passenger planes involved under the simulated situation after the proclamation of a wartime mobilization order, the report said.
					
					 The south Korean authorities, overheated with the fever for invading the north, are becoming all the more frantic in their moves to ignite a war by mobilizing all human and material resources.

articles.title: Unjust Construction of Jeju Naval Base under Fire
articles.content:
Unjust Construction of Jeju Naval Base under Fire

					 Pyongyang, August 26 (KCNA) -- The Priests' Group for Justice and Peace of the Episcopal Church of south Korea and two other religious organizations issued a joint statement, according to the south Korean Internet paper Jaju Minbo on August 23.
					
					 The statement laid bare the injustice of the construction of the Jeju naval base, noting it is aimed at depriving inhabitants there of their cradle, destroying ecological environment and threatening peace.
					
					 The "government" and the military authorities are pushing forward the construction of the base despite the opposition of different circles to meet their interests, the statement noted, adding that they seek to help the U.S. government achieve its purpose of escalating the military tension on the Korean Peninsula and the U.S. munitions monopolies such as the Lockheed Martin Company realize their desire to sell interceptor missiles, radar system, etc. to be loaded on warships to anchor at the Jeju naval base.
					
					 It is as clear as noonday that if the naval base is built on Jeju Island, it will turn into a U.S. military base, the statement said, stressing: The plan for building the base should be nullified.

articles.title: General Strike in S. Korea
articles.content:
General Strike in S. Korea

					 Pyongyang, August 26 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Media Trade Union on August 23 entered into  a general strike to protest against the authorities' moves to put it under their control for staying in power.
					
					 The strikers held a rally in Seoul that day.
					
					 At the rally speakers noted the media has come into the possession of specified forces under the present regime, thus whitewashing the pro-Japanese, pro-American dictators.
					
					 The "Grand National Party" is giving special benefits to Chosun Ilbo, Choongang Ilbo and Dong-A Ilbo for staying in power for a long period while attempting to take discriminating measures against other media, they charged.
					
					 Media persons will pool their efforts with different circles to wage a dynamic struggle to check the moves of the ruling forces to put media under their control, they stressed.

articles.title: S. Korean Prosecution Accused of Crackdown on Teachers
articles.content:
S. Korean Prosecution Accused of Crackdown on Teachers

					 Pyongyang, August 26 (KCNA) -- A south Korean opposition party representative staged a demonstration at the Kwanghwamun Plaza in Seoul Tuesday, calling for political rights of teachers and public officials. 
					
					 Accusing the prosecution of charging some 1,900 teachers and public officials with support for a progressive party, the representative urged the "government" authorities to stop the political crackdown at once.

articles.title: Guarantee of Political Rights of Teachers and Government Employees Demanded in S. Korea
articles.content:
Guarantee of Political Rights of Teachers and Government Employees Demanded in S. Korea

					 Pyongyang, August 26 (KCNA) -- Elders of south Korean civic and public organizations held a press conference on August 22 at which they published a declaration demanding the authorities guarantee the political rights of teachers and government employees.
					
					 The prosecution indicted more than 1,900 teachers and government employees on the charge that they aided a progressive political party, the declaration said.
					
					The people are expressing deep concern about the unprecedented indictment by the prosecution, pointing out that the specter of the erstwhile military dictatorial regime has been revived, it deplored.
					
					 It urged the authorities to take necessary steps so that the teachers and government employees may enjoy their political rights.
					
					 It urged the "government" to stop at once the politically-motivated suppression of the progressive forces and the prosecution to retract the indiscriminate indictment.

articles.title: Japan-resident Koreans Aid Quake Victims
articles.content:
Japan-resident Koreans Aid Quake Victims 

					 Pyongyang, August 26 (KCNA) -- A meeting was held at the Ibaragi Prefectural Headquarters of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) on Aug. 12.
					
					 Aid fund sent by the Chongryon Central Emergency Measure Committee was conveyed to the headquarters to help recover from damage caused by the March 11 killing earthquake and tsunami. 
					
					 The meeting was attended by Nam Sung U, vice-chairman of the Chongryon Central Standing Committee, Ri Yong Hun, chairman of the prefectural headquarters, and other officials and Koreans in Japan. 
					
					 Addressing the meeting, Nam said that Chongryon officials and Korean compatriots in Miyagi, Iwade, Fukushima and Ibaragi prefectures have made devoted efforts to recover from the damage as quickly as possible and revitalize the whole work of the headquarters, including the stabilization of the afflicted compatriots and resumption of national education. 
					
					 The officials and patriotic-minded businesspersons are striving hard to rehabilitate the destroyed hall of the Ibaragi prefectural headquarters and let Chongryon organizations in the prefecture put their work on track at an early date, he said. 
					
					 The aid fund for rehabilitating the hall amounts to 3,000,000 yen. 
					
					 Speakers said the officials of the prefectural headquarters and Korean compatriots have made dynamic activities to recover from the damage, encouraged by the relief fund sent by General Secretary Kim Jong Il. They also voiced their determination to hasten the hall rehabilitation with the help of the aid fund and turn out in the drive for making a fresh turn in the development of Chongryon.

articles.title: Struggle for Shattering Moves for War of Aggression against DPRK Called for
articles.content:
Struggle for Shattering Moves for War of Aggression against DPRK Called for

					 Pyongyang, August 26 (KCNA) -- Cha Sang Bo, vice-chairman of the General Association of Koreans in China, on August 19 issued a statement titled "Let all fellow countrymen get united as one to resolutely shatter the moves for war of aggression against the north".
					
					 The General Association of Koreans in China and all the Koreans in China condemn the U.S. imperialists and the south Korean puppet warmongers for staging the Ulji Freedom Guardian joint military exercises across south Korea despite the unanimous opposition of the people at home and abroad, the statement said.
					
					 It has become clear who wants peace and reunification and who seeks a war on the Korean Peninsula, it noted, and went on:
					
					  The U.S. and the puppet group should clearly know that they can attain nothing but disgrace and defeat from the anti-DPRK confrontation and war moves.
					
					  The General Association of Koreans in China and all the Koreans in China will together with all the fellow countrymen turn out as one in the struggle to shatter the moves of the anti-DPRK confrontation and war maneuvers against the north of the U.S. and the south Korean puppet belligerent forces.
					
					 The U.S. and the south Korean puppet forces should properly understand the spirit of Songun Korea and stop running riot and halt at once the saber-rattling.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Songun Feats Praised by Foreign Media
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Songun Feats Praised by Foreign Media 

					 Pyongyang, August 26 (KCNA) -- Foreign media carried special write-ups and reports to mark the 51st anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's start of the Songun revolutionary leadership. 
					
					 The August issue of a Lao newspaper carried an article illustrated with a photo of Kim Jong Il acknowledging the cheers of the crowd.
					
					 The political and ideological might of the Korean People's Army and the single-minded unity of the whole society reached the highest level thanks to his Songun leadership for more than 50 years, the paper noted, and continued:
					
					 Factories in the field of machine-building industry have been put on a CNC basis and steel, fiber and fertilizer industries have been placed on a Juche basis and light industrial factories modernized at a high level. The shout of the slogan "Push back the Frontiers of Latest Science and Technology!" is heard from the fields of education, public health and literature and the arts. This is the picture of modern Korea whose appearance has changed dramatically.
					
					 The State Radio of Laos released a similar report on August 19.
					
					 The Iranian paper Iran News on August 18 devoted one whole page to several articles with a photo of Kim Jong Il acknowledging the cheers of the participants in the military parade.
					
					 La Prosperite, a paper of Democratic Congo, on August 17 carried an article praising his Songun leadership feats with a photo of him standing in the tribune of honor of the military parade celebrating the 65th anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea.

articles.title: DPRK's Important Day Marked in Different Countries
articles.content:
DPRK's Important Day Marked in Different Countries

					 Pyongyang, August 26 (KCNA) -- Events took place in different countries on the 51st anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's start of the Songun revolutionary leadership. Photo exhibitions and film shows were held in South Africa and Nigeria and film shows in Mongolia, Malaysia and Thailand from August 16 to 25.
					
					 Displayed in the venues of the photo exhibitions were photos on his Songun revolutionary leadership feats and those on the invincibility of the Korean People's Army.
					
					 Films shown included "Fireworks for a Thriving Nation" and "Arms of Korea". 
					
					 Present at the events were officials of the Mfumalanga Provincial Committee of the South African Communist Party, the South African Association of Friendship and Solidarity with Korean People, the Nigeria-Korea Stereo Industrial Company, Unit 0151 of the Mongolian Frontier Army, the UM Cooperation General Company of Malaysia and the Universal Surveying Company of Thailand and masses.
					
					 Lectures were given by the Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia Association of Guinea, the Guinean Society for the Study of the Juche Literary Idea and the Dwi Mitra Perkasa of Indonesia on the same occasion.

articles.title: UFG Slammed by Foreign Organizations
articles.content:
UFG Slammed by Foreign Organizations

					 Pyongyang, August 26 (KCNA) -- Organizations of France and Democratic Congo denounced the U.S. and the south Korean authorities for staging the Ulji Freedom Guardian joint military exercises.
					
					 The France-Korea Friendship Association in an appeal on August 19 said that they are misleading public opinion, claiming UFG is one of "defensive" nature but it is saber-rattling for a war of aggression against the DPRK, to all intents and purposes.
					
					 The DPRK solemnly declared it had no choice but to bolster its nuclear deterrent for self-defence both in quality and quantity to cope with the situation prevailing on the Korean Peninsula, the appeal said, and went on:
					
					 We demand an immediate stop to the provocative UFG against the DPRK to cope with the situation where peace and security on the Korean Peninsula are being gravely threatened.
					
					 We call upon the progressive forces and peace-loving forces of the world to take an active part in the international signature campaign for urging an early conclusion of a peace treaty in the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 The Working Citizens' Association of Democratic Congo in a statement on August 18 noted that UFG is a very provocative act of defying the strong warnings of the DPRK and the will of the world peace-loving people.
					
					 With no rhetoric can the U.S. and the south Korean warmongers justify their military provocations against the DPRK, it said.
					
					 The U.S. should stop at once the joint military exercises against the DPRK, respecting the unanimous will of progressive mankind aspiring after peace, conclude a peace treaty with the DPRK and normalize the relations with it, it urged.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Politics of Attaching Importance to Youth Appreciated by World Public
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Politics of Attaching Importance to Youth Appreciated by World Public

					Pyongyang, August 26 (KCNA) -- World public is highly praising General Secretary Kim Jong Il for pursuing the politics of attaching importance to the youth and loving them with deep attention to the youth movement. 
					
					 The Chinese People's Daily said that Kim Jong Il attached great importance to the youth movement, put forward the youth as the most viable combat unit and provided them with the slogan "Let Us Live to Glorify Youth!" and a view on life.
					
					 The Egyptian paper Al-Misaiya noted that the Korean youth are possessed of the revolutionary and sound ideological and moral traits as the politics of attaching importance to the youth is enforced in the DPRK.
					
					 The chairman of the Indian Youth Group for the Study of Works of Comrade Kim Il Sung said President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il regarded the issue of youth as a fundamental one related to the future destiny of the country, the nation and the revolution, put forward the original ideas and theories on the youth movement and worked heart and soul to intensify it.
					
					 The Nepali paper Arpan stressed that the Korean youth are growing to be successors to the revolutionary cause of Juche, heroes of the era and fighters of the Songun revolution, a proof of the validity and vitality of the idea of the Workers' Party of Korea on attaching importance to the youth.
					
					 The chief of a branch of the Ethiopian Youth Study Group of the Juche Idea noted that the Korean youth led by Kim Jong Il will certainly build a thriving socialist nation on their land in the near future.

articles.title: China Strives to Increase Agricultural Production
articles.content:
China Strives to Increase Agricultural Production

					 Beijing, August 25 (KCNA) -- The Chinese party and government are attaching importance to the agricultural production in building socialism with the Chinese characteristics and paying big efforts to it.
					
					 Under the steps taken by the state, experts have been dispatched to rural areas to decrease natural damage to the maximum and scientifically guide the manure and cultivation of crops.
					
					 A brisk drive is going on to build reservoirs and farmland irrigation facilities.
					
					 In recent years reservoir repair work has been done to prevent 161 million mu of farmlands from being inundated.
					
					 Land alignment is progressing apace. 718 000 mu of terraced fields have been built across the country in a little more than one year.
					
					 China planned to build 40 million mu of sloping fields into standardized terraced fields during the 12th Five-Year Plan and got to this work.
					
					 It is intensifying the work to disseminate agricultural science and technology and introduce advanced farming technology.
					
					 All units of the country are now researching and breeding new good strains to enhance the yield per unit of crops including rice, wheat and maize and, at the same time, actively disseminating advanced science and technology.

articles.title: Hu Jintao Calls for Perfecting Land Control System
articles.content:
Hu Jintao Calls for Perfecting Land Control System

					 Beijing, August 25 (KCNA) -- Hu Jintao, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China, stressed the need to perfect the land control system on August 23 when presiding over the collective study of the Political Bureau of the CPC Central Committee.
					
					 To establish and perfect the strict land control system is one of the matters to implement the scientific outlook on development, a strategic step to guarantee the country's food security and a long-term plan to bring happiness to the rising generations and achieve great prosperity and eternal development of the Chinese nation, he said.
					
					 He urged the party committees at all levels and the government to regard the land control as an important work and strengthen the guidance over it.

articles.title: Chinese VP Calls for Fresh Progress in Economic Development
articles.content:
Chinese VP Calls for Fresh Progress in Economic Development

					 Beijing, August 25 (KCNA) -- Chinese Vice-President Xi Jinping called for bringing into full play the great spirit displayed during the past earthquake rescue work.
					
					 During his inspection tour of Sichuan Province from August 19 to 22, Xi said party organizations at all levels and cadres affiliated with the party in the province should deeply study President Hu Jintao's July 1 important speech and improve the mode of economic growth.
					
					 They should also strengthen the social management and promote the socio-economic development in the province to make a fresh progress in the period of the 12th five-year plan, he added.

articles.title: Cadres Urged to Sincerely Serve People in China
articles.content:
Cadres Urged to Sincerely Serve People in China

					 Beijing, August 25 (KCNA) -- Li Yuanchao, head of the Organization Department of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China, called for learning from the patriotic spirit displayed by the Daqing people.
					
					 During his inspection tour of Heilongjiang Province on August 20 and 21, he said it is important to encourage cadres affiliated with the party to go straight with a strong sense of responsibility for their work, sincerely serve the people and take the lead in activities for building advanced basic party organizations and becoming fine communists.

articles.title: China Plans to Train Technical Personnel
articles.content:
China Plans to Train Technical Personnel

					 Beijing, August 25 (KCNA) -- China plans to concentrate on training 3 000 middle-aged and young personnel capable of guiding scientific and technical innovations in ten years. 
					
					 The plan is aimed to increase the number of scientific and technical personnel so that the country can join the ranks of innovation-oriented states in 2020 and build a comprehensively well-off society.

articles.title: Independent Innovations Urged in China
articles.content:
Independent Innovations Urged in China

					 Beijing, August 25 (KCNA) -- Zhang Dejiang, vice-premier of the State Council of China, called for promoting independent innovations in the country's munitions industrial sector.
					
					 During his recent inspection tour of the Space Science and Technology Group, Zhang said the group should seek a unique way of scientific development, making innovations in an independent way.

articles.title: China Calls for Campaign to Follow the Example of Wu Mengchao
articles.content:
Campaign to Learn from Veteran Medical Man Launched in China

					 Beijing, August 25 (KCNA) -- China has launched a campaign for following the example of Wu Mengchao.
					
					 Wu, an academician and director of Orient Liver and Cholecyst Surgical Hospital affiliated with Military Medical University No. 2, has devotedly worked in medical service for 68 years, putting the interests of the Communist Party and the people above anything else. 
					
					 The decision concerning the campaign was distributed recently by the Publicity Department of the Party Central Committee, Ministries of Education, Science and Technology, and Public Health, and General Political Department of the Chinese People's Liberation Army.  
					
					 The decision said the campaign is aimed to encourage the whole party, army and all the people to implement the strategic tasks of the 12th five-year plan, greatly contributing to building an innovation-oriented country and a comprehensively well-off society.

articles.title: Hong Kong University Celebrates 100th Anniversary
articles.content:
Hong Kong University Celebrates 100th Anniversary

					 Beijing, August 25 (KCNA) -- Hong Kong University in China celebrated its centennial anniversary on Aug. 18.
					
					 Addressing the celebration, Li Keqiang, vice-premier of the State Council, congratulated the university on its anniversary on behalf of the central government.
					
					 The university should train many able personnel and greatly contribute to the development of Hong Kong and the nation, he said.

articles.title: Iran says U.S. Hikers' Sentence Based on Right Judiciary Procedure
articles.content:
Iran says U.S. Hikers' Sentence Based on Right Judiciary Procedure

					 Tehran, August 25 (KCNA) -- Iranian Foreign Ministry spokesman Ramin Mehmanparast said in an interview with a TV on Sunday that the verdict issued for two U.S. hikers held in Iran was based on the "right judiciary procedure" and the "independence of (Iran's) judiciary system."
					
					 The two U.S. hikers were sentenced to eight years in prison on the charges of illegal entry into the country's territory and espionage. 
					
					 The Iranian court has followed the legal procedure in dealing with the illegal entry of Shane Bauer and Josh Fattal into the country and the espionage charges against them, Mehmanparast said.

articles.title: Iran to Give Crushing Response to Any Aggression: President
articles.content:
Iran to Give Crushing Response to Any Aggression: President

					Tehran, August 25 (KCNA) -- Iran's President Mahmoud Ahmadinejad, addressing an event on Tuesday, clarified the stand to resolutely shatter the enemy's aggression moves.
					
					 Iran's defense policy is based on deterrence and its response to any possible aggression would be annihilating, he said.
					
					 He noted that Iran would use its military power against injustice and aggression.
					
					 "Our military power would not be used for taking over lands of other nations and in the meantime, looting their resources," he stressed.

articles.title: Iran Strives to Strengthen Naval Force
articles.content:
Iran Strives to Strengthen Naval Force

					 Tehran, August 25 (KCNA) -- Iran continues to pay big efforts to strengthening the naval force.
					
					 The Iranian Ministry of Defense and Armed Forces Logistics on August 23 opened to the public Qader anti-ship cruise missile with a range of 200km, Bonyan sea engine and Valfajr torpedo system on the Defense Industry Day.
					
					 They will reportedly contribute to bolstering the defense capability of Iran.

articles.title: Iran's Army to Defend Its Country
articles.content:
Iran's Army to Defend Its Country

					 Tehran, August 25 (KCNA) -- Iran's army in a statement on August 20 expressed the willingness to defend the country by mobilizing all the military power.
					
					 Iran's military power has been put on the high level capable for firmly defending the country in any case, the statement said, adding that the enemy's pressure and sanctions compel Iran to achieve self-reliance in the defense field and register great successes.
					
					 Iran's army and people will make every possible effort to continue strengthening the defense capability, it stressed.

articles.title: Russia Speeds Up Development and Modernization of Far East Region
articles.content:
Russia Speeds Up Development and Modernization of Far East Region

					 Pyongyang, August 26 (KCNA) -- The Far East Region of Russia is abundant in underground, forest and marine resources.
					
					 Oil and natural gas developed in Sakhalin Region, Khabarovsk Territory and Maritime Territory are main sources for the economic development of the Far East Region.
					
					 The first liquefied gas plant of Russia based on the hi-tech has been built in Yuzhno-Sakhalinsk City. Its annual output is about 10 million tons. It has been reported that if the plant keeps production in full capacity, it can provide five percent of the global liquefied gas supply amount.
					
					 The terminus of Eastern Siberia-Pacific oil pipeline was extended to Nakhodka City, laying a base for export of oil in the Far East Region by tankers.
					
					 A due attention is being paid to development of the fisheries and the fish processing industry in the region.
					
					 The Maritime Territory accounts for 15 percent of Russia's aquatic output, and Vladivostok and Nakhodka cities are leading centers of the fisheries and the fish processing industry.
					
					 An urban modernization drive has been stepped up in the Far East Region.
					
					 In particular, a campaign is taking place to renew Vladivostok City where the APEC summit will be held in 2012.
					
					 Russian Prime Minister Vladimir Putin said at a meeting that Vladivostok City would become an economic, cultural, scientific and educational center of the Far East Region and one of the recognized major cities of the country.

articles.title: New Vaccine Developed in Cuba
articles.content:
New Vaccine Developed in Cuba

					 Havana, August 25 (KCNA) -- Cuba has recently developed new vaccine to prevent five diseases.
					
					 The new vaccine named Heberpenta can prevent diphtheria, tetanus, tosferina, hepatitis B and influenza B.
					
					 It has been jointly developed by the Cuban Genetic Engineering and Bioengineering Center and other scientific research institutes. It is being applied in across the country.

articles.title: 26th Summer Universiade Closes
articles.content:
26th Summer Universiade Closes

					 Beijing, August 25 (KCNA) -- The 26th Summer Universiade closed in Shenzhen City, Guangdong Province, China on August 23.
					
					 Present at the closing ceremony were leading officials of the Chinese party and government, the president of the International University Sports Federation and delegations and players of various countries and regions including the DPRK.
					
					 The vice-chairman of the Organizing Committee of the Universiade and the president of the Federation made speeches.
					
					 Then a ceremony of putting off the torch of the Universiade took place.
					
					 An art performance was given at the closing ceremony.

articles.title: Pakistan Damaged by Flood
articles.content:
Pakistan Damaged by Flood

					 Pyongyang, August 26 (KCNA) -- Heavy monsoon rains and flooding have reportedly affected over 2 million people in Pakistan's southern Sindh and eastern Punjab provinces.
					
					 100 villages were flooded in Badin district of Sindh after a breach in a major salinity drain.
					
					 The relief work is being done in the afflicted areas.

articles.title: Thailand's Economic Growth
articles.content:
Thailand's Economic Growth 

					 Pyongyang, August 26 (KCNA) -- Thai economy grew by 2.9 percent in the first half of 2011, the government of this country said on August 22.

articles.title: Egyptians Protest against Israeli Murder
articles.content:
Egyptians Protest against Israeli Murder

					 Cairo, August 25 (KCNA) -- Hundreds of Egyptians held a rally in the capital city of Egypt on August 20 to protest against Israeli murder.
					
					 Chanting anti-Israel slogans, they condemned Israel's missile shooting of several Egyptian soldiers to death in its border area and asked for an official apology for the incident.
					
					 They demanded the government get the Israeli embassy withdrawn from Cairo and cut off ties with Israel.

articles.title: Americans Stand against Government's Economic Policy
articles.content:
Americans Stand against Government's Economic Policy

					 Pyongyang, August 26 (KCNA) -- Americans complain of the government's economic policy.
					
					 According to the results of a recent national survey released by Gallup, a public opinion survey organ of the U.S., 71 percent of the respondents expressed strong discontent with the economic policy of the present administration.

articles.title: Cambodia Attacked by Dengue Fever
articles.content:
Cambodia Attacked by Dengue Fever

					 Pyongyang, August 26 (KCNA) -- Dengue fever is spreading in Cambodia, causing damage.
					
					 From January to July this year, some 7,867 cases of dengue fever had been reported and 40 children died, the minister of Health of this country said on August 22.
					
					 The government is taking steps to prevent the epidemic.

articles.title: Belarus Discontinues Nuclear Cooperation with U.S.
articles.content:
Belarus Discontinues Nuclear Cooperation with U.S.

					 Pyongyang, August 26 (KCNA) --The Foreign Ministry of Belarus recently announced that the country would stop nuclear cooperation with U.S. and freeze the highly-enriched nuclear fuel exchange plan.   
					
					 According to the director of the ministry's Information Department, the announcement was a countermeasure to the U.S. decision to impose new economic sanctions on Belarus.
					
					 The director termed the decision unfounded and illegal.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il realiza visita a region autonoma de Mongolia Interior
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il realiza visita a region autonoma de Mongolia Interior

					　Pyongyang, 26 de agosto (ACNC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, realizo el dia 25 una visita a la region autonoma de Mongolia Interior, situada en la region nordeste de la Republica Popular China, en el camino de regreso a la patria tras concluir la visita a las regiones de Siberia y Lejano Oriente de Rusia.
					
					　Ese dia por la tarde, el Dirigente llego a la estacion fronteriza de Manzhouli de la region autonoma de Mongolia Interior. 
					
					　Cuando paro el tren en la estacion, le acogieron cordialmente el jefe del Departamento de Enlace Internacional del Comite Central del Partido Comunista de China, Wang Jiarui, el ministro de Ferrocarriles, Sheng Guangzu, el secretario del Comite del PCCh en la Region Autonoma de Mongolia Interior, Hu Chunhua, el secretario general del mismo comite, el secretario del Comite Municipal del PCCh en Hulun Buir, el alcalde de Hulun Buir, el secretario del Comite Municipal del PCCh en Manzhouli, y otros cuadros directivos en el centro y localidad. 
					
					　El Dirigente intercambio saludos y departio con los cuadros chinos que vinieron para acogerle. 
					
					　 Wang Jiarui dijo que por el encargo del camarada Hu Jintao y del colectivo central de direccion de China, vino como enviado especial a Manzhouli para guiar al estimado camarada Kim Jong Il quien pasa por China y expreso la maxima consideracion al Dirigente quien con sus energicas actividades exteriores hace gran aporte a la amistad entre los paises y al cumplimiento de la causa de independencia de la humanidad. 
					
					  El Dirigente expreso agradecimiento a la calida bienvenida de Wan Jiarui y otros cuadros directivos en el centro y localidad y los habitantes. 
					
					  Guiado por los cuadros directivos del Comite del PCCh y el gobierno en la region autonoma, recorrio el municipio de Hailar de la ciudad de Hulun Buir y, contemplando su paisaje nocturno, se entero de la historia y cultura de la region y del exito de los habitantes en la construccion. 
					
					  El Comite del PCCh en la Region Autonoma ofrecio un solemne banquete en la Casa de Huespedes de Estado Tianjiao para dar bienvenida al Dirigente. 
					
					  El Dirigente fue invitado al convite de bienvenida. 
					
					  En la ocasion hubo discursos. 
					
					  Hu Chunhua dijo que al acoger al camarada       Kim Jong Il en esta estepa, donde el Presidente   Kim Il Sung visito en varias ocasiones recibiendo  calidas bienvenidas, se logro el deseo del partido, el gobierno y los habitantes de la region autonoma. 
					
					　La tradicional amistad China-Corea sera eterna como estepa junto con la historia, senalo y expreso conviccion de que el amistoso pueblo coreano lograria nuevos exitos en el mejoramiento de la vida del pueblo y en la construccion del Estado prospero. 
					
					　Se ofrecio una funcion artistica preparada especialmente para dar bienvenida a Kim Jong Il.
					
					　Los artistas de la region autonoma incluyendo el Conjunto Nacional de Canciones y Danzas de Hulun Buir pusieron en la escena diversas piezas de fuerte idiosincrasia, entre otras, la cancion y danza nacionales "Cancion de boda", el solo de instrumento nacional "Amplia estepa", la danza "Baile con tazones", el coro "Te llama", etc. y la cancion coreana "Arirang".
					
					　A traves de la funcion, los ejecutantes demostraron el infinito respeto y veneracion del gobierno y los habitantes de la region autonoma hacia el Dirigente quien volvio a realizar la visita a China por el desarrollo de la amistad China-Corea.
					
					　Kim Jong Il transmitio un cesto de flores felicitando el exito de funcion y se fotografio junto a ellos.
					
					　Hu Chunhua le obsequio presente a nombre del Comite del PCCh en la Region Autonoma.
					
					　El Dirigente expreso agradecimiento por la calida bienvenida y el trato hospitalario del partido, el gobierno y los habitantes de dicha region autonoma y manifesto la esperanza de que bajo la direccion del PCCh, los habitantes de la region autonoma lograrian nuevas victorias en la lucha por la prosperidad y el desarrollo del pais.
					
					　Ese dia, el Dirigente partio hacia el proximo destino recibiendo el saludo caluroso de despedida de los cuadros de la region autonoma.
					
					　Le acompanan en la ocasion Kim Yong Chun, miembro del Buro Politico del CC del PTC y ministro de las Fuerzas Armadas Populares, Kang Sok Ju, miembro del BP del CC del PTC y viceprimer ministro del Consejo de Ministros, Jang Song Thaek, miembro suplente del BP del CC del PTC y vicepresidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional, Kim Yong Il, Kim Yang Gon, Pak To Chun y Thae Jong Su, miembros suplentes del BP y secretarios del CC del PTC, Pak Pong Ju, primer subjefe de departamento del CC del PTC, O Su Yong, secretario responsable del Comite del PTC en la Provincia de Hamgyong del Norte, Ji Jae Ryong, embajador acreditado en China, y Ri Ki Bom, consul general en Shenyang.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il pasa por la provincia china de Heilongjiang
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il pasa por la provincia china de Heilongjiang

					　Pyongyang, 26 de agosto (ACNC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, paso el dia 26 por la provincia de Heilongjiang de la Republica Popular China.
					
					 El llego esta manana a la ciudad de Qiqihar de la provincia.
					
					  Cuando llego a la estacion ferroviaria de Qiqihar el tren con Kim Jong Il a bordo, le acogieron cordialmente el secretario del Comite Provincial del Partido Comunista de China en Heilongjiang, Ji Bingxuan, el gobernador de la misma provincia, Wang Xiankui, el secretario del Comite Municipal del PCCh en Qiqihar y el alcalde de Qiqihar y otros cuadros directivos del partido y el gobierno de la provincia y la ciudad.
					
					  Entre sus acompanantes figuran Kim Yong Chun, miembro del Buro Politico del CC del PTC y ministro de las Fuerzas Armadas Populares, Kang Sok Ju, miembro del BP del CC del PTC y viceprimer ministro del Consejo de Ministros, Jang Song Thaek, miembro suplente del BP del CC del PTC y vicepresidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional, Kim Yong Il, Kim Yang Gon, Pak To Chun y Thae Jong Su, miembros suplentes del BP y secretarios del CC del PTC, Pak Pong Ju, primer subjefe de departamento del CC del PTC, O Su Yong, secretario responsable del Comite del PTC en la Provincia de Hamgyong del Norte, Ji Jae Ryong, embajador coreano en China, y Ri Ki Bom, consul general coreano en Shenyang.
					
					  Llegaron tambien con el los cuadros chinos del centro como el jefe del Departamento de Enlace Internacional del Comite Central del Partido Comunista de China, Wang Jiarui, y el ministro de Ferrocarriles, Sheng Guangzu.
					
					  Kim Jong Il intercambio saludos y converso con los cuadros que le recibieron.
					
					  Ji Bingxuan dio calida bienvenida a Kim Jong Il en nombre del comite provincial del partido, el gobierno y el pueblo de Heilongjiang, destacando que es un gran honor y orgullo tener otra vez en su region al Dirigente quien continua su largo viaje al extranjero para la amistad entre los paises.
					
					  Este dia, Kim Jong Il, de visita en la region nordeste de China, fue recibido atentamente por el consejero de Estado de la RPCh, Dai Bingguo, quien llego a la provincia de Heilongjiang por el encargo especial del Secretario General Hu Jintao y el Comite Central del PCCh.
					
					  Kim Jong Il y Dai Bingguo saludaron uno al otro y sostuvieron conversaciones.
					
					  Dai Bingguo saludo calurosamente a Kim Jong Il en nombre del Secretario General Hu Jintao, la direccion del PCCh y todo el pueblo chino, apuntando que la region nordeste de China, que volvio a tenerle a los 3 meses, esta envuelta en el clima de alborozo para darle bienvenida.
					
					  Las valoraciones, que ha dado el camarada        Kim Jong Il durante su visita a Mongolia Interior y la provincia de Heilongjiang sobre la construccion por la modernizacion del socialismo en China, devienen un estimulo y apoyo ilimitados al pueblo chino que avanza bajo la direccion del PCCh, dijo Dai Bingguo expresando la voluntad del partido, el gobierno y el pueblo chinos de luchar activamente junto con los camaradas coreanos por fortalecer y desarrollar la tradicional amistad China-Corea.
					
					  Dai Bingguo ofrecio una recepcion en la Casa de Huespedes de Estado de Sianhe en la ciudad de Qiqihar para dar bienvenida a la visita de              Kim Jong Il a la region nordeste de China.
					
					  Este dia, Kim Jong Il se informo del estado de desarrollo economico de la provincia de Heilongjiang recorriendo varias empresas y obras de construccion urbana de las ciudades de Qiqihar y Daqing.
					
					  Le acompanaron en el recorrido Dai Bingguo, Wang Jiarui, Sheng Guangzu, Ji Bingxuan, Wang Xiankui, y otros cuadros directivos del partido y el gobierno del centro, la provincia y las ciudades.
					
					　Kim Jong Il visito el Grupo de Maquinas Herramientas no.2 de Qiqihar y la fabrica filial de la Compania de Industria Lactea de Mengniu en Qiqihar. 
					
					　Escucho explicaciones sobre el estado de construccion urbana y el plan perspectivo en la sala de exhibicion de urbanismo de la ciudad de Daqing y recorrio el area de construccion de viviendas en el contorno de la zona pantanosa, un gran puente y el puente del lago Liming y otros puntos de la provincia.  
					
					　El Comite Provincial del PCCh ofrecio por la noche de este dia un banquete en honor de          Kim Jong Il en la Casa de Huespedes de Estado no.9 de Daqing.
					
					　Fue invitado a la recepcion el Dirigente          Kim Jong Il.
					
					　Ji Bingxuan senalo que esta visita historica a la provincia de Heilongjiang, que repite el camarada Kim Jong Il a los 3 meses, es una muestra contundente de la amistad China-Corea en constante desarrollo.
					
					　Subrayo que el partido, el gobierno y el pueblo de la provincia desempenaran mayor papel junto con el pueblo coreano en continuar y desarrollar de generacion en generacion la amistad China-Corea.
					
					　Se ofrecio una funcion artistica preparada especialmente para el Dirigente.
					
					　En la ocasion actuaron famosas entidades de arte nacional y artistas de la region incluyendo la banda musical nacional y el conjunto de danza del Teatro de Canciones y Danzas de la provincia de Heilongjiang.
					
					　En el repertorio estuvieron las piezas de diferentes generos como el solo masculino "Cancion de remeros de Wusuli Jiang", el baile "Bendicion", el duo de instrumentos musicales "Festejo" y las canciones coreanas "!Encantado!", "Campanula", etc.
					
					　Kim Jong Il mando un cesto de flores a los ejecutantes felicitandoles por la exitosa funcion.
					
					　El comite del partido y el gobierno popular de la provincia le dedicaron este dia un presente.
					
					　El agradecio la calida bienvenida y agasajo del comite del partido, el gobierno y los habitantes de la provincia china y expreso su esperanza de que bajo la direccion del PCCh, esos ultimos lograran nuevas victorias en la lucha por la prosperidad y el desarrollo del pais.
					
					　Este dia, partio hacia su proximo destino recibiendo calurosos saludos de despedida de Dai Bingguo y los cuadros directivos de dicha provincia.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il envia mensaje de agradecimiento a Medvedev
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il envia mensaje de agradecimiento a Medvedev

					　Pyongyang, 26 de agosto (ACNC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, envio el dia 25 un mensaje de agradecimiento al presidente de la Federacion Rusa, Dmitri Anatolievich Medvedev, al regresar a la patria luego de concluir la visita a las regiones de Siberia y Lejano Oriente de Rusia.
					
					　La misiva va como sigue:
					
					　Al regresar a la patria tras concluir la visita a las regiones de Siberia y Lejano Oriente de Rusia, amistoso pais vecino, expreso mi profundo agradecimiento a Usted, el gobierno ruso, los funcionarios directivos de las Zonas Federales de Siberia y Lejano Oriente y el amistoso pueblo ruso por habernos acogido y agasajado cordialmente.
					
					　Me siento muy satisfecho de que durante la presente visita me encontre con Usted y llegamos al consenso en todos los asuntos de interes mutuo.
					
					　Durante el recorrido por amplia tierra de Siberia y Lejano Oriente de Rusia, quedamos muy impresionados viendo con nuestros ojos propios a los diligentes habitantes de estas zonas, que dedican sus sinceros sudores por el desarrollo socioeconomico y la prosperidad.
					
					　Estoy convencido de que en el futuro tambien las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion Corea-Rusia de larga historia seguiran fortaleciendose y desarrollandose mas de acuerdo con el espiritu acordado esta vez entre nosotros.
					
					　Aprovecho esta oportunidad para desear a Vd. y el pueblo ruso mayores exitos en sus trabajos para construir Rusia poderosa y moderna.
					
					　Al mismo tiempo, formulo sinceros votos por buena salud de Vd.

articles.title: Rubricado protocolo entre Corea y Rusia
articles.content:
Rubricado protocolo entre Corea y Rusia

					　Pyongyang, 26 de agosto (ACNC) -- Quedo firmado el dia 26 en el Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae el protocolo de la 5a reunion de la comision intergubernamental para la cooperacion en comercio, economia, ciencia y tecnologia entre los gobiernos de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y la Federacion Rusa.
					
					  En la ocasion participaron Ri Ryong Nam, ministro de Comercio Exterior y presidente de la parte coreana de la comision arriba mencionada y otros funcionarios coreanos, los miembros de la delegacion economica gubernamental de Rusia encabezada por el ministro de Desarrollo Regional, Viktor Basargin, presidente de la parte rusa de la citada comision, y Arkady Lavrov, encargado de negocios a.i. de la embajada rusa en Corea.
					
					  Ri Ryong Nam y Viktor Basargin suscribieron el documento.

Ri Yong Ho se reune con delegacion militar rusa
